captions.text:
(LAUGHTER)
AND FOLKS, INTERNET EQUALITY IS

MORE IMPORTANT THAN EVER, AS I
LEARNED THIS WEEKEND WHEN THE

INTERWEBS TRIED TO SWALLOW ME
WHOLE.

BUT I AM PROUD TO SAY THAT I GOT
LODGED IN ITS THROAT AND IT

HACKED ME BACK UP LIKE A HASTILY
CHEWED CHICKEN WING.

(LAUGHTER)
THIS IS WHO'S ATTACKING ME NOW.

(CHEERS AND APPLAUSE)
TO FIND OUT WHAT HAPPENED TO ME

ON THE INTERNET, WE TURN TO THE
TV.

>> PEOPLE ARE CALLING FOR THE
STEPHEN COLBERT SHOW TO BE

CANCELED AFTER A TWEET ABOUT
ASIANS APPEARED ON THE COMEDY
CENTRAL TWITTER ACCOUNT.

>> #CANCELCOLBERT IS
TRENDING THIS MORNING.

>> #CANCELCOLBERT IS TRENDING
THIS MORNING.
>> #CANCELCOLBERT WENT VIRAL.

>> Stephen: BUT FOLKS, I'M
STILL HERE!

(AUDIENCE CHANTING "STEPHEN")
>> Stephen: IT'S ALL BECAUSE
OF YOU PEOPLE!

THE DARK FORCES TRYING TO
SILENCE MY MESSAGE OF CORE

CONSERVATIVE PRINCIPLES MIXED
WITH YOUTH-FRIENDLY PRODUCT
PLACEMENT HAVE BEEN THWARTED.

(LAUGHTER)
WENT THROUGH A FEW OF THESE THIS
WEEKEND.

BUT FOLKS, I'M NOT GOING TO
LIE -- IT WAS CLOSE.
WE ALMOST LOST ME.

(LAUGHTER)
I'M NEVER GOING TO TAKE ME FOR
GRANTED EVER AGAIN.
HERE'S WHAT HAPPENED TO ME.

LAST WEDNESDAY, I SALUTED
WASHINGTON REDSKINS OWNER DANIEL

SNYDER FOR HIS NEW CHARITY, THE
WASHINGTON REDSKINS ORIGINAL
AMERICANS FOUNDATION.

WHICH SOME HAVE CALLED AN
OBVIOUS ATTEMPT TO WIN OVER

NATIVE AMERICANS BECAUSE IT ONLY
USES THE TERM "REDSKINS" ONCE IN
ITS NAME.

(LAUGHTER)
NOW, I HAVE MY OWN RACIAL

MISUNDERSTANDING WITH THE ASIAN
COMMUNITY OVER A LONG-RUNNING

AND BELOVED CHARACTER ON MY
SHOW.
VERY IMPORTANT.
HE IS A CHARACTER.
HE IS NOT ME.

THIS IS THE REAL STEPHEN
COLBERT.

I MEAN EVERYTHING I SAY ON THIS
SHOW.
HE MEANS...
WELL, YOU WOULD HAVE TO ASK HIM.
AND HE'S NOT RETURNING MY CALLS.

ANYWAY, I WAS SO INSPIRED BY DAN
SNYDER'S CHARITABLE OUTREACH
THAT I FORMED MY OWN CHARITY.

"THE CHING CHONG DING DONG
FOUNDATION FOR SENSITIVITY TO
ORIENTALS OR WHATEVER."

(LAUGHTER)
THAT WAS WEDNESDAY.

IT RERAN FOUR TIMES ON THURSDAY,
WAS POSTED ON THE SHOW'S
Facebook PAGE.
NOT A PEEP OUT OF THE INTERNET.

THEN AROUND 7:00 ON THURSDAY, MY
NETWORK'S PROMOTIONAL TWITTER

ACCOUNT, @COLBERTREPORT, TWEETED
THE NAME OF MY FOUNDATION

WITHOUT PROVIDING A VIDEO LINK
TO THE ORIGINAL SEGMENT OR

MENTIONING THAT I WAS INSPIRED
BY THE REDSKINS CHARITY.

WHO WOULD HAVE THOUGHT A MEANS
OF COMMUNICATION LIMITED TO 140

CHARACTERS WOULD EVER CREATE
MISUNDERSTANDINGS?

(LAUGHTER)
BUT I HAVE NEVER ONCE USED
@COLBERTREPORT.

AS YOU HEROES KNOW, I'M
@STEPHENATHOME.

THOUGH FULL DISCLOSURE, I
SOMETIMES TWEET FROM

@STEPHENATHOME AT WORK IN THE
BATHROOM.

THEN, WHEN THE TWIT HIT THE FAN,
THE BRAIN TRUST AT MY NETWORK

TOOK THE TWEET DOWN, BECAUSE
THAT'S HOW THIS INTERNET WORKS.

YOU CAN JUST TAKE STUFF DOWN AND
NO ONE WILL EVER KNOW IT
HAPPENED.
JUST ASK MAYOR WIENER.

(LAUGHTER)
NOW, I'M NOT TRYING TO THROW
ANYONE UNDER THE BUS HERE.

MOSTLY BECAUSE I DON'T GO THAT
CLOSE TO PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION.

BUT WHEN I SAW THE TWEET WITH NO
CONTEXT, I UNDERSTOOD HOW PEOPLE
WERE OFFENDED.

SAME WAY I, AS AN
IRISH-AMERICAN, WAS OFFENDED

AFTER READING ONLY ONE LINE OF
JONATHAN SWIFT'S "A MODEST
PROPOSAL."
I MEAN, EAT IRISH BABIES?!
HASHTAG CANCEL SWIFT!
TREND IT!

(LAUGHTER)
(APPLAUSE)

NOW, ALL OF THIS WAS STARTED BY
A HASHTAG ACTIVIST, OR A

HASHTIVIST, WHO HAS BEEN
VICIOUSLY ATTACKED ON TWITTER.

IF ANYONE IS DOING THAT FOR ME,
I WANT YOU TO STOP RIGHT NOW.
SHE'S JUST SPEAKING HER MIND.

THAT'S WHAT TWITTER'S FOR, AS
WELL AS RUNNING THE ENDING OF

EVERY SHOW I HAVEN'T WATCHED
YET.

NOW, THE CANCEL COLBERT PEOPLE
THINK THAT EVEN IN CONTEXT, I'M
A RACIST.

I JUST WANT TO SAY THAT I'M NOT
A RACIST.
I DON'T EVEN SEE RACE.
NOT EVEN MY OWN.

PEOPLE TELL ME I'M WHITE, AND I
BELIEVE THEM BECAUSE I JUST

DEVOTED SIX MINUTES TO
EXPLAINING HOW I'M NOT A RACIST.

(LAUGHTER)
(APPLAUSE)

AND THAT'S ABOUT THE WHITEST
THING YOU CAN DO.

NOW, ONCE THE CANCEL COLBERT
HASHTAG GOT ROLLING, IT WAS ONE

TO HAVE THE TOP FIVE TRENDS FOR
MORE THAN 36 HOURS BECAUSE

EVERYBODY WANTS TO TALK ABOUT
THE KING.

(LAUGHTER)
THEN IT WAS PICKED UP BY A SMALL

GROUP OF AMERICANS WHO GET THEIR
INFORMATION "ONLY" FROM
TWITTER -- THE NEWS MEDIA.

THERE WERE ONLINE STORIES IN THE
"U.S.A. TODAY," THE

"NEW YORKER," "VARIETY,"
"SLATE," THE "HUFFINGTON POST,"

THREE FEATURES ON "TIME DOT-COM"
AND SEVEN ON "SALON."

CNN EVEN TOOK A BREAK FROM THEIR
MALAYSIAN AIRLINER COVERAGE TO

REPORT SPOTTING WHAT THEY
THOUGHT WAS THE WRECKAGE OF MY
SHOW OFF THE COAST OF AUSTRALIA.

(LAUGHTER)
(APPLAUSE)

BUT MAYBE MOST HURTFUL, MY
FELLOW CONSERVATIVES ABANDONED
ME IN MY TIME OF NEED.

LIKE MICHELLE MALKIN, WHO
"CO-SIGNED" ON TO CANCEL-COLBERT
AND CALLED ME A "COWARD."

THIS CUTS DEEP, ESPECIALLY SINCE
I LEARNED EVERYTHING I KNOW

ABOUT SENSITIVITY TO THE
ASIAN-AMERICAN EXPERIENCE FROM

MICHELLE'S 2004 BOOK, "IN
DEFENSE OF INTERNMENT."

(AUDIENCE BOOING)
TURNS OUT THEY HAD IT COMING.

(LAUGHTER)
ONE LESS THING TO FEEL GUILTY
ABOUT.

SO TO RECAP -- A WEB EDITOR I'VE
NEVER MET POSTS A TWEET IN MY

NAME ON AN ACCOUNT I DON'T
CONTROL, OUTRAGES A HASHTAG

ACTIVIST, AND NEWS MEDIA GETS 72
HOURS OF CONTENT.
THE SYSTEM WORKED!

(LAUGHTER)
BUT THIS ALL STARTED RIGHT AFTER

I TAPED THURSDAY NIGHT'S SHOW,
SO I COULDN'T RESPOND UNTIL
TODAY.
IN A SENSE, I "WAS" CANCELED...
FOR THREE DAYS.
JUST LIKE JESUS.

title: The Colbert Report: Who's Attacking Me Now? - #CancelColbert

comments.text:
A hundred years ago, during times with no Internet, Twitter, etc., each 
village big or small had their village idiot (like e.g. Suey Park). Maybe 
they met once a year for a "Village Idiot Summit of the Year", which is 
fine, but most of the time, they stick to their own because they had no 
platform (well, maybe a few passerby when they sat on their favorite wall). 
Now they have Internet and Twitter.
Which is great because now they can give the whole community a good laugh, 
not just some passerby.﻿

comments.author: Jamie Arran

comments.text:
Watched the Anita Sarkeesian video a bit ago, was always irked that it's 
the only Colbert video with comments disabled. Since I can't complain over 
there I just clicked the first Colbert link from that page. 

Skipping my angry Anita comments for a sec, I'll ask a very simple question 
to start. Why, Colbert, are the comments disabled on the Anita video?

For as long as I can remember seeing your show, you've been a shining 
beacon of humor and tongue-in-cheek political commentary. That video 
reminded me of Chris Rock's joke about Michael Jackson on 60 Minutes. "He 
tried his hardest to make Michael look like a person..." asking leading 
questions to attempt to dignify his guest. You did the same, you gave every 
solid question you could to lead Anita to giving an honest answer and 
talking about an issue, but every time she just circled right around to 
"But gamergate, and harassment, and people hate the womens!"

Your show has been a series of "high points", and that interview was the 
only time I ever remember watching your show and being disappointed.﻿

comments.text:
I seriously thought Colbert MUST be joking about Makin writing that book, 
right?
Wikipedia:
In Defense of Internment: The Case for 'Racial Profiling' in World War II 
and the War on Terror (ISBN 0-89526-051-4) is a 2004 book written by 
conservative American political commentator MICHELLE MAKIN. Malkin defends 
the United States government's internment of Japanese Americans in 
relocation camps during World War II and racial profiling of Arabs during 
the post-2001 War on Terror. The book's message has been condemned by 
Japanese American groups and civil rights advocates.[1][2] Its scholarship 
has been criticized by academics.[3][4]

Jesus Fuck, THIS lady called Colbert racist?  She's a fuckin' neo-nazi! 
 She wants people of specific races put in jail.  Gawd, no wonder she's on 
Fox.﻿

comments.author: Anthony Pirtle

comments.text:
+Thuoi Ly 
Congratulations!! I take it by your deleted comment, which originally gave 
the definition for satire and was immediately followed up by another 
statement claiming satire is oppressing to ethnic minorities, that you 
finally get it! YEAAAAH~ feels good right, but I have to know how many 
times did it take you to re-read the comments and re-watch this video?? 
Short cut for you in the future, when there's a group of people telling you 
that you have a fundamental misunderstanding about something, odds are you 
do. Stop what you're doing and rethink your point of view, in a different 
light! Simply insisting that you're correct and need to be heard once again 
will not solve your problem ; )
Finally, you can make a satirical remark, comment, statement, comic, 
article, play or piece about anything. However, to say; "it's wrong for the 
human oppressor to make satire against oppressed humans"- this is not only 
incorrect grammar usage of the term, it's also faulty logic.

comments.text:
+Thuoi Ly 
You're using the term satire incorrectly. Please educate yourself if you 
wish to catch up and have a conversation here with the rest of us. I 
suggest you re-read Candice's first comment, my response and also farrex0's 
last comment, especially take note of the last few lines. Then re-watch the 
Colbert video. Repeat this process a few times if you still hear thoughts 
in your head telling you satire is oppressive to minorities. Good luck on 
your journey!

context was explained. She dragged his name through the mud and instead of 
standing up to her he was too afraid and threw gamers (that were 
complaining about corruption in gaming media) under the bus. He let Anita 
use his show to obfuscate and high jack the cause. He sacrificed gamers but

comments.text:
Straight up referenced Swift's (a.k.a. The Great Satirist's) "A Modest 
Proposal" and still people don't get it's satire or what that even means. 
He's poking fun at Daniel by saying he made a foundation, like Daniel, but 
making it more obvious it's racist, this way people will see that The 
Washington Redskins Original Americans Foundation is an attempt by what 
appears to be an racist potentially ignorant of his own racism to claim he 
is not racist or to "make amends".  This will hopefully inspire some change 
as that is what satire is about, inspiring change, it's what separates it 
from mere sarcasm or other rhetorical devices.﻿

comments.author: Andrew Arnold (BuzzWeedle)

comments.text:
+Andrew Arnold "redskins" belies a passion for battle that "natives" does 
not. "redskins" is a meaningful term which, in the context of USING THE 
TITLE FOR YOUR OWN SPORTS TEAM THAT YOU CARE DEARLY FOR belies downright 
REVERENCE for the original redskins' unbridled passion. Fuck no to renaming 
it.
Stop eating out of the pussybin.
comments.author: Justin Crediblename

comments.text:
+lcg3092 You honestly think more people would be offended by it? Honestly, 
the fact that we carry genes that make our skin light because we used to 
live in an area where there wasn't a lot of sunlight, and people who 
happened to carry those genes were evil towards people who didn't would be 
used to justify the name. Dividing by skin color still exists, and it is 
just as ridiculous as dividing by hair color or nose shape or eye color. 
Like, why is there a "Black History Month"? I am certainly not against 
learning about your personal roots, but why isn't it "Human History Month", 
a month where we can *all* celebrate our greatest achievements. Like, I'm 
not supposed to take any pride in any inventions made by people in the past 
if they don't have my skin color? It's ridiculous. It's racism disguised as 
anti-racism.
comments.author: Andrew Arnold (BuzzWeedle)

comments.text: +lcg3092 rednecks like to be called rednecks lol
comments.author: Luke Mulford

comments.text:
+Andrew Arnold it really isn't the same thing...you are comparing words 
that have been used through decades, even centuries, to offend and justify 
the oppression of a group of people with another that just recently became 
used and it really doesn't offend a lot of people...it doesn't offend a lot 
of people not because white people are more "thick skinned" than other 
races, it's because it doesn't bring the historical and social package the 
others do...now, a better example would be if you created a football team

comments.author: Outdoor Mirrorist

comments.text:
+Andrew Arnold why are you dancing around the fact that there is physical 
evidence and proof and facts and stats that support the idea that there is 
still systematic racism in America and white people are more advantaged. 
Example if Jerome Williams and Jack Smith both send in an identical resume 
to a company the whiter sounding name is 3x more likely to get a call back. 
A black man is likely to receive a 10x more harsher penalty than a white 
man for an identical crime. And there are still laws in place TODAY in 
America that were put in place to specifically target minorities. So no, 
racism is not over, and no I'm not going to let some privileged punk bitch 
who couldn't last 3 days in a black man's shoes tell me what i should or 
should not be offended by. As a black man I have to prove myself every 
fucking day that I'm not a bad guy, you probably just get the benefit of 
the doubt. thats just a little taste of the privilege you are blind to.
comments.author: Luke Mulford

comments.text:
+Luke Mulford Dude, the fucking president is black, you clearly have a shot 
if you try. Words are words, they have no emotional meaning to them. There 
are only thoughts. If you say "Ching Chong Bing Bong Foundation for Asian 
Americans" making fun of the fact that there is a Redskins foundation for 
Native Americans, there isn't any malicious intentions. If you call someone 
a chink, that is malicious. If you make a joke saying you hate when someone 
says N-word, and you go "not nigger by the way" and specify that you hate 
when a white lady on CNN says N-word, that is funny, there is no evil 
behind that word. If you call someone a nigger (unless you are using it as 
a term of endearment, some people do that, kind of like how white people 
used to call each other a son of a bitch) then there is evil behind that 
word. I get it is offensive, but he wasn't calling any asians a chink, he 
was making fun of something racist. But for 20 year old black people to act 
like they have to go through way more shit than white people is fucking 
ridiculous. We are all eating a shit sandwich, and at the end of the day it 
doesn't matter whether you have it on white bread or rye, it is still a 
shit sandwich.
comments.author: Andrew Arnold (BuzzWeedle)

comments.text:
+Andrew Arnold so since I have never been a slave that all the sudden takes 
all of the history and offense away from the word "nigger"? I am trying to 
explain why your "chicago crackers" analogy has nothing in common with 
words that are historically associated with hate, violence, oppression and 
many more evil vile things. I honestly don't care if the random jo shmo is 
racist, i have a problem when minorities are continuously targeted, tried, 
and convicted than their white counterpart for the exact same crimes. Once 
our justice system has true equality then ill "get over it". And if you 
want to go around calling black people "nigger" then be my guest, I'm just 
trying to educate you on why you would look like the bigger jack ass than 
the black man calling you "cracker". Its not my fault or your fault that 
white people tied the word with the worst part of America's pastime, but 
thats just the way it is maybe you should "get over it". All you want is to 
be racist and not frowned upon and black people want a fair fucking shot in 
the US legal process. Get it?
comments.author: Luke Mulford

comments.text:
+Luke Mulford I didn't call you nigger. Also, you yourself didn't have to 
go through slavery or innequality. Now, I am actually okay with a 60 year 
old black man being racist, it's just how he is, he hates whites because of 
how he was treated. But I don't like it when really young people of color 
act like they are treated horribly every day like that Suey Park broad. The 
problem with people like her, white or otherwise, is that they don't view 
their racism as something wrong because they don't even believe they can be 
racist. Anyway, can we at least agree that nobody should judge others based 
on what other members of their race have done, or what race they are?
comments.author: Andrew Arnold (BuzzWeedle)

comments.text:
+Andrew Arnold I love how your whole response was you defending yourself 
from me calling you a racist lol. Newsflash, not every black person thinks 
"the man" is out to get them. Here's a better explanation sir: If i hear a 
white man call me "nigger" i can only think that he agrees with the 
atrocities that happened back then. Why? Because white men associated that 
word with hatred towards black people. Why? I don't know but it is a fact 
that white Americans continue to ignore, but please tell me more about the 
Holocaust because that was much worse than 400 years of slavery in America.
comments.author: Luke Mulford

comments.text:

but whatever.

their ancestors did.
